core_principles: Immersion First: HUD elements must feel like part of a helmet display, not a website.
Information Hierarchy: Combat-critical info (Ammo, Health) is peripheral but high-contrast. Center is for aiming.
Tactical Aesthetics: Use specific military/tech visual language (scanlines, skew, monospaced data) over generic rounded corners.

usage.headings: Use 'Chakra Petch' with font-bold and tracking-wider for HUD labels (HEALTH, AMMO). Uppercase always.
usage.body: Use 'Rajdhani' for general text and menus. It has a square, tech feel.
usage.data: Use 'JetBrains Mono' for changing numbers (ammo count, coordinates) to prevent layout jitter.

layout.grid_system: The UI is split into two layers: 1. The 3D Canvas (z-0, fullscreen). 2. The HUD Overlay (z-10, absolute, pointer-events-none).

hud_structure.health_panel: Bottom Left. Fixed position. Skewed container (-10deg) to simulate curved visor.
hud_structure.ammo_panel: Bottom Right. Fixed position. Skewed container (10deg).
hud_structure.crosshair: Absolute Center. Fixed. 4px gap in middle.
hud_structure.kill_feed: Top Right. Vertical stack. Fade out items after 3s.
hud_structure.menus: Centered modal with backdrop-blur-xl and dark overlay.

spacing.hud_margin: p-8 or p-12 (Keep elements away from very edges)

custom_components.name: HealthDisplay
custom_components.description: A segmented bar chart (20 segments) rather than a continuous progress bar. Color changes from Green to Red as health drops.

custom_components.name: AmmoCounter
custom_components.description: Large numeric display (text-6xl) + icon of weapon.

custom_components.name: Crosshair
custom_components.description: Dynamic SVG. Expands when shooting/moving. Color: White with 1px black outline for visibility on all backgrounds.

custom_components.name: DamageIndicator
custom_components.description: Full-screen red vignette overlay that pulses opacity based on health < 30%.

custom_components.name: GameMenu
custom_components.description: Start / Game Over screen. Solid background with 'scanline' texture overlay.
custom_components.style: Use 'Chakra Petch' for massive titles. Buttons should be rectangular with 'cut' corners (clip-path).

component_rules.buttons: Do NOT use rounded-full. Use sharp edges or chamfered corners (clip-path: polygon(...)). Hover state: Glitch effect or invert colors.
component_rules.panels: Background MUST be semi-transparent black (#151816/90) with a 1px border (#3c4b2a). Add 'backdrop-blur-md'.
component_rules.shadows: Use colored shadows for glowing effects. e.g. shadow-[0_0_10px_rgba(143,166,59,0.5)]

textures.scanlines: Overlay a repeating linear gradient on the entire screen (opacity 0.05) to simulate a monitor/visor.
textures.vignette: Darken the corners of the screen using a radial gradient overlay to focus attention on the center.
textures.noise: Add a subtle grain overlay (opacity 0.03) to reduce digital flatness.

three_js_guidelines.lighting: Atmospheric. Use ambient light (intensity 0.3) + directional light (moonlight/sun) + point lights for muzzle flashes.
three_js_guidelines.fog: Use scene.fog = new THREE.FogExp2('#0a0a0a', 0.02) to hide map edges and create depth.
three_js_guidelines.materials: Use 'MeshStandardMaterial' for realism. Textures need to be gritty (roughness > 0.6).
three_js_guidelines.camera: PerspectiveCamera with FOV 75. Add slight 'bobbing' motion on movement for realism.

assets.icons: Use 'lucide-react' for HUD icons (Crosshair, Shield, Zap (ammo)).

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'KeyboardControls' from drei for WASD movement.
Use 'PointerLockControls' from drei for FPS look.
Create a 'GameOverlay' component that sits ON TOP of the Canvas (z-10).
Ensure the Canvas has 'className="absolute inset-0 z-0"'.
Use the color palette rigidly. Do not invent new colors.
For the 'Start Screen', create a cinematic layout with the game title in 'Chakra Petch' font-black text-6xl.
Add 'data-testid' to: start-button, health-display, ammo-display, game-over-screen.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors: separates good from extraordinary.
Components MUST use named exports (export const ComponentName = ...)
Pages MUST use default exports (export default function PageName() {...})
